meanings.definition: Existing or occurring within a molecule.
meanings.sent1: The intramolecular bonds hold the atoms together inside the molecule.
meanings.sent2: Chemists study the intramolecular interactions to understand how molecules behave.
meanings.sent3: The intramolecular dance of atoms inside the molecule was quite fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent4: The intramolecular harmony among the atoms created a stable molecule.
meanings.sent5: The concept of intramolecular forces can be visualized as a tiny dance party within a molecule.

meanings.definition: Relating to the forces within a molecule.
meanings.sent1: The intramolecular forces determine the stability of the molecule.
meanings.sent2: Understanding intramolecular attractions helps predict chemical reactions.
meanings.sent3: The intramolecular tug-of-war between atoms made the molecule wobble comically.
meanings.sent4: The intramolecular battle for electrons resembled a microscopic game of capture the flag.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing intramolecular forces is like watching invisible hands holding a molecule together.
